pLHjc9-dGr8aoxDLCOLHXw.text: The views, the food, and a great place to be when Pittsburgh does fireworks off the point.

oxChHj0vbAkYGGpXhXD2TA.text: Like anywhere in this city, it is a chore to drive there.  Parking was next to impossible and after that the place is CLOSED

W33_pRtC_b6T_ZvT30ovIQ.text: Sorry, but this place ruined our anniversary. We had a 6:30 reservation for the deck, and when we arrived, the hostess told us they "forgot" and just gave away the last table. They should have somehting in 10-15 minutes, and she would go check. She disappeared for 45 minutes!! No tables, but she didn't want to tell us. When I asked to speak with the manager, I was told that he was out running errands and wouldn't be back for a couple of hours. How can you justify the manager being gone during dinner rush? Know what the worst part was? No one ever once said "I'm Sorry"...that would have went a long way. Long-time customer will never go back

4Dvi24mpRxEkrEJt5WHk6g.text: Awesome view and service.  Not too pricey for a Grandview restaurant

4rHFAefmqdED44Zg4jCVSA.text: Sorry to say this place was a huge let down.  Just because a business has a view they should not expect the patrons to settle for lack luster food.  The risotto was like a dry sponge.  I think they were trying to pass off the tablespoon of yellow liquid on the veal as hollandaise sauce.  The steak was fair.  If you want a quality steak you better head to Longhorn.  This was an overpriced dinner.  They should also think of investing in a decorator.  The dining room could use some wall decor.  Note to owner:  Pittsburgh is filled with wonderful artist. Go out on a sat to the artist market up there and buy something.  Not all your tables have the view of the city, give these people something to look at while they are waiting for their overpriced meal.

eICcWtGrlwB9X7XMvisSqg.text: party of 2. had reservations for 630, arrived at 615 and were seated right away. when i called originally i asked for a seat by the window. they said they cant guarantee it but noted it and would try. we sat one  table away from the window, which still made for an amazing view. however the people right against the window were paying the bill and we asked if we could move over once they left. the server was very nice and said no problem after asking the host. this happened after we ate our salads. he busted the table quickly and made the little move very smooth and easy. the view is totally amazing. i ate here in the winter, and looking below at the deck, during the summer im sure it would be even a bit better. the food i have to say was a little disappointing. i heard the food is very good here, but i wasnt too impressed. my fillet was very avgerage, for an above average price. garlic mashed potatoes were decent. the salad with house dressing was way too small, it was tiny and pretty plain, i really liked the dressing though. the steak sauce that came with my fillet, which normally id never use any sauce, but i tried a bite with it, and the sauce was very good and i finished my steak using it. the 12oz sirloin was the other dish ordered and i finished her last 4 bites, actually, i had only 2 bites, as it was awful i thought. very tough and dry. she had green beans as her side which were ok. no dessert,. her two vodka martinis were very good and priced right as was my beers. its 3 stars because the service was good. our waiter was very nice and made the meal better because with his good service. and the view is unreal and the atmosphere and decor are very nice. although there is a tv mounted on the wall in the dining room which seemed very out of place. if it was on, it would kill the intimate, romantic vibe that it offers. maybe its there for the staff to watch while the place is closed?  because i couldnt see why it would ever be on any other time. the bar downstairs is very nice and you can still get the view. its pretty small, but a perfect place to have drinks before or after the meal. after tip it was exactly $100, which included 2 kettel one martinis, and 2 beers, no dessert.  overall i liked the restaurant, i liked the cozy feeling there, the big windows, friendly staff, i just wish the food was a little better as it was very average.

Ah4nLJF7qZ7_wbXS8QwuYQ.text: Loved the view from the patio!!! Food was great too!! Am Definitely going to visit again.

kSbSjloF6AU_OV4qdZHOYw.text: Berry Long Island iced tea was delish, as was their cheesesteak. Breathtaking view on the deck. Loved the atmosphere.

T7u52czGNt-WyX0w5c_pIg.text: Great for a date night! The food was great, and the view was even better! The location is great right next to the Duquesne incline. The staff was wonderful. We got the coconut chicken and the steak, and both were perfection. I would definitely recommend!

5PVnNVVJNapKGant298BnQ.text: This establishment offers the atypical view of Pittsburg and the confluence of the three rivers (the Allegheny, the Monongahela and the start of the Ohio). Prices are twice what they should be for the meals and drinks offered but after all, you are paying for the view.

0bwHs_f7twIuEzt6eQurMg.text: Stopped here for a Valentine's dinner. Heard the view was amazing and that was the only thing that didn't disappoint. First off, the place needs a total redo. It looks like it's stuck in the 90s. Second, the wait staff was alright, not the best. Our waitress was accommodating when I was served sour wine but then dropped the ball when she brought the 18$ appetizer out with our entree. Last, the food was meh. Nothing special but for the prices they charged the food was ok at best. I wish I could say I liked it better, but, I won't. I will not return.

X0c13EFClRenw9jK0-HMlg.text: This place is fantastic and should have way more stars! Walked in got a window seat for four. Kayla took such great care of us.  The price was super reasonable for as much as we ate and drank. Everyone was like mines Soo good and I final shared mine towards the end! Everyone knew I got the best meal on this one!  Best Porter house I've ever had!  I would order this cut more often if it tasted like this.  Rare n hot on hot plate.

FaykF172EFJ5FqThNAVuhw.text: Drinking and being stupid with the knucklegraggers i work with... Food was superb and Dortmunder on tap!!! View of the 'Burgh was fantastic!!! Has a GREAT time!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Food is excellent and i got all loopy on my FAV beer GLB Dortmunder!!!!

0HN_JHqajsdkGP0onjOAXA.text: I created an account so I could share the bad experience I had at Grandview Saloon.  Yesterday was my wife and I's first anniversary.  We decided we would go up to Mt. Washington and stare at the city while we eat/drink for our special occasion.  Monday, my wife called and made reservations for Thursday at 7:30pm and requested a table by the windows.  She was told that it wasn't a problem but there might be a 5-10 minute wait for a window table even with a reservation.  That' was no problem.  Being the punctual person that I am, I was walking through the door at 7:30pm.  Told the hostess that we were there for our reservations.  This is where it gets bad.   We were told that the people who had reservations at 6:30pm still haven't arrived and that we no longer have the option for a window table.  She told us they were a whopping HOUR late for their reservation.  She explained that the group was from Philly and got lost and stuck in traffic.  Who in the hell continues to hold a reservation when the group is over an HOUR late?  My wife was pretty disappointed considering we made reservations four days prior.  As for the food, it was pretty mediocre.  Lets just say you're not going for the food.  You're going for the view.  I got the homemade crab cake dinner with a Caesar salad and steak fries.  My wife got the salmon dinner with a side salad and french fries.  My wife said the salmon was pretty decent.  They had to send my plate back because someone plated the wrong sides with my crab cakes.  For being about $30 a plate, I expected the food to be a lot better.  As stated before and by a lot of other people.  Don't set your expectations high on anything other than the view.  That's what you're going there for.  I want to send a shout out to the group from Philly who arrived an hour late for their reservation and messing up mine.

UtDE61Xnjdm0dUOhe3M1Uw.text: My friends and I came to Grandview Saloon to celebrate a birthday. We had made reservations for 730. We arrived right on time, but the hostess said that we would have to wait for a while since all their  reservations were behind from much much earlier in the day. We ended up waiting for over a half an hour. By the time we were seated, our waitress seemed very much disinterested in us. Food was quite delicious, but not before several of us were served plates of pasta that were cold. They had to have been sitting out for at least 20 minutes to be that cold to be honest. The food is good, but there are many places in the city that serve food just as well if not better and have good service on top. I would honestly think twice about eating here again.

_3yzhk6nv1_6i0XKAZBzhg.text: After waiting at the podium for 5 minutes, the hostess finally comes out and greets us. We then tell her we have 6 and one child. Her response was "sorry, we don't allow children under the age of 6, they're a liability." This is absolutely absurd. Every person stepping into the building is a liability... I have worked in the hospitality business for approximately 20 years and have never heard of such a thing. Pretty sure it's illegal. After leaving in disgust, we walked around to find out nothing else in the area was open at the time. If I could leave zero stars, I would. After reading many reviews, I'm glad I didn't waste my money. Do yourself a favor, keep walking. You can see the view at the top of the hill.

NTmqbyrVfXDSHJZ_zi0hgA.text: They exercised their right to refuse us service because we were accompanied by a child under the age of 6. I'm exercising my right to Yelp them 1 star. Consequently, we found our way to Bigham Tavern, dropped $100, got fat and drunk and had a blast!

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No children under the age of 6 allowed on premises!

yisByMzspfvuWjImWA60iQ.text: Do not go here The service is terrible and my Gyro tasted like crap I took one bite out of it and didn't like it and they did not want to refund me my money  The server was nowhere to be found

W6_n59Ny-Nf4N25WLcYZIQ.text: Great filet event better view. Definitely a great place to get the best view of Pittsburgh and some awesome food as well.

zGLdb7ShuxP__uHLIY-Xkw.text: Great view of the city, the staff here is so nice and does a great job!  Good selection for beers if your in to craft beers

ifOt2sMRdTDdOZvOrPmBVQ.text: Had the Whaler sandwich... The note on the menu says enormous piece of Cod and they weren't kidding!  Breaded very lightly it was quite tasty. The fries were ok. The homemade chips tasted great.   The view over the city is spectacular. Right next door to the Incline so you can't miss the place.

tL7vYbpCc0VG0quWxuNejQ.text: Great view! French onion soup was the best! Go here and watch the sun go down and the lights of Pittsburgh come on for an unforgettable experience. Service was the best, Shelley made us feel like we were the most important customer in the room. Great service, great food, great view. Couldn't be any better.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Fm5N4xnOIDlOJrFpW1LqYw.text: The view was phenomenal. The service was actually really great too...he let us split the check even, for a group on 9. Unexpected, but wonderful, particularly since not everyone brought cash. The food...  Ummmmm....it's ok, I guess. The fries are good. I got the French onion which was clearly the bottom of the pot and had been simmering all day long. It as way too thick and way too concentrated. I couldn't eat it. I was really disappointed.  The mezze platter was good, but nothing too special.   I probably won't go out of my way to go back, but might go back, steering clear of several menu items.

-jVIPCqMCZHaUdjT1teVNw.text: Love, love this place. I was in Pittsburgh just for a day and came here by accident, the views of Pittisburgh are amazing and the drinks were really good.   I didn't get to try the food but I will make sure to come back here next time I'm back in town.

Qm5U2pUVMzhSqZvCBGhkJg.text: The view here is fantastic, the staff is great, and the food is fabulous. I had the stuffed shrimp with crabmeat and they were colossal  shrimp with lump crabmeat stuffing, they were great and tasted so fresh, the wife had the filet salad which was great, if you want to impress someone definitely try it out here and eat out on the patio

IKarynXgM-GZG0XRVXWkow.text: My boyfriend and I came here to eat when we visited for 4th of July weekend.  I was shocked that we were able to get a seat immediately outside on the gorgeous deck.  The view is insane.  If you get there around the time of the sunset which we were lucky enough to do, it is spectacular.  The food was pretty good as well.  I got the coconut chicken and potatoes which was excellent and a unique option.  My boyfriend got the stuffed chicken parm (which wasn't really stuffed, it was pretty much 2 pieces of chicken parm with ricotta cheese sandwiched in the middle) but either way he enjoyed it.  The grilled chicken nachos were awesome as well.    The only thing I have to say to people going there is that beware that there are two inclines; the one that you take from Station Square, the Monongahela Incline, doesn't bring you near this restaurant.  The other incline, the Duqesne Incline brings you right by it.  We didn't know this and took the Monongahela Incline up and we did walk to the restaurant but it was a bit of a long walk on a hilly road.    Overall it was a great experience and one of the best parts of our trip!

UzBSdnE4wNJCkCu-s1pRhg.text: By far the worst restaraunt in Pittsburgh for holding a reservation. The manager, Sue Getner, is completely responsible for cancelling a party for 75 people. Excuse used by Samantha was they didn't hear back from us. Well your email said and I quote, "no rush... I have secured the date for you." Completely False! Maybe just maybe before you use the excuse that we didn't receive a deposit you should call or email us. Especially since we have had parties with you in the past. Never again....horrible place

VLwWzFOjpNUR9_NYDOrvlA.text: A friend and I got drinks here just so we can sit on the outdoor deck for the amazing view of the city. The cocktails there were average priced, especially considering the deck view. Definitely worth checking it out if you happen to be on Mt. Washington.

W8k3xfY3LTRQuHM4R8rVig.text: I took the incline up on a beautiful fall day, and decided to try out the crabcake sandwich and a local brew while watching the sunset. It was not crowded, so I got a table upstairs by the window, and very much enjoyed the beer while waiting for the food to arrive. My server was busy but very friendly, advising me on the different beers they had on tap. My sandwich was good, full of crabmeat, and maybe even a little too big as I didn't finish it all. I lingered over another beer just after the sunset before taking the incline back down the hill. I recommend this experience, especially if you can hit an "off" time so that you can sit by the window.

I7nasaaRX0pQVCz2-WkBMA.text: Horrible service and food. The staff was awful and unapologetic. They spilled drinks across people as they were passing drinks. Multiple people ordered a special that came out cold and raw in the middle. They slammed the food down in front of people and were unapologetic about it.  The drinks too forever to arrive and they even told us that they didn't put the order in until over 10 minutes after we gave our orders. They kept excusing the delay by telling us that they were packed - something that was NOT reflected in the amount of people around us. It took so long for them even to take our orders and the food took an unreasonable amount of time to come out.  There was nothing redeeming about the visit except the view. I would avoid at all costs and would never recommend this place to anyone. They were unprofessional to a degree I have rarely experienced.

yBYZF47AXnhDA8cHByzIzg.text: This place has a great outdoor deck, with a million dollar view of the city. Unlike some of the other spots on Mt. Washington, the food and beer here is affordable. Food is average, a mix between bar food and upscale dining. That said, their dessert is the best thing on the menu. Try the triple chocolate tower cake, it's amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sept 20, 2016

C0css408RPL_RGgD_6-g4g.text: The view was amazing! The restaurant atmosphere and food not worth the price. We had a party of nine and of all of the meals, only one was really worth mentioning, which were the scallops. The ribeye steak was overcooked, the mahi-mahi was also overcooked and dry. They also charged an additional eight dollars for two young children to split one meal, which was a $26 plate of salmon.  Again you can't beat the view, it was absolutely beautiful but this place is absolutely not worth the prices that they are charging. Even when we had a problem with our food and asked for a manager, we were told there wasn't even a manager on site and it was a Saturday evening.  You can definitely find a better!

UVlfuGv9qCZr0_xXn-6FoA.text: Great view of course but you pay for that. Food is surprisingly good. No kids under 6 allowed for some reason. Multiple tiers of restaurant and a nice deck. Certainly a place for first day of spring and a cold beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

b6zMR_CUkvvMxR3E25NL0w.text: If you are looking for a great view this is a perfect choice. However, if you're  looking for anything more go elsewhere.  The service was incredibly slow; the food was mediocre at best. Too many other great choices to waste your time here.

pjc281_UjVePDAmU7abzIw.text: A wise man once told me, "all of life's disappointments come from failed expectations." Nothing Truer has ever been said, and that statement also applies here.  OK, OK, I'll admit that when I first entered the place, I was concerned by the decor as well. A glance at the enormous menu offering what appeared to be a mundane slew of tired old "American Food" items left me a bit melancholy as well. I think that I am a bit less critical because these two first impressions set the bar a little low for me.  BUT... the draft beer was nice and cold, the staff working up on the deck that night were very attentive and friendly, and the gyro I ordered was... AWESOME! (One of the wait staff recommended it, saying it was probably the best thing on the menu.) Forget $50 porterhouse steaks here - why the hell would you do that? Go to Morton's, Capital Grille, or Ruth's Chris if you want to spend a fistful of money on some muscle to gnaw on.  I would disagree with the 5 star (?!?!) and 1 star reviews here. This place isn't The French Laundry on Mount Washington OR Pittsburgh Food Hell Meets Third World Inflation... It is a place with a great view and some tasty items you have to sort out from the rest of the "Bennigan's meets TGI Friday's meets Applebee's meets Bar Food" stuff. If you have the time and the patience, give the place a try if you are in the vicinity. Hopefully you will visit on a good night, and the view will make up for most of the shortcomings you may encounter.  And remember to set your expectations appropriately - the Michelin reviewers will never set foot in this place. You know that. Sites like this can help too - read what people are saying...

23cLKM2JzaFR_COl2vJPPw.text: Made reservations two weeks in advanced requesting seats with a view, they seated us without one, then a table became available with a view, and they gave it to some people who did not have a reservation and told us simply "sorry" - the food is absolutely not worth your money; the purpose of this place is the view, which they don't accommodate even if you plan in advance for. Go to Altius or Monterey bay - significantly better food and service.

KYhborACkOG6Zz3XRGSN3w.text: worst place in pittsburgh. Can't even cook a steak. don't waste your time.

PdW3_g5KACQrEPcGyYY6XQ.text: I haven't eaten here yet, but would give five stars for the view alone!  My dad and I went to the Duquesne Incline and then had some time to burn before his flight home, so we stopped next door at the Grandview Saloon for a beer and to hang out for a bit.  The patio is fantastic with a wonderful view of the rivers, and you can watch the incline go up and down.  They had a decent selection of beer (although we were uncreative and went with Yuengling) that was nice and cold and reasonably priced given the location.  Our server was prompt and friendly.  I'm guessing there's more interesting food options in downtown Pittsburgh, but I'd definitely stop here for the view again, especially with visitors.

tC28kVPfZ0TnlvHVmYlUKQ.text: Mediocre food, mediocre service, at the table for an hour and 10 minutes and after a $350 bill they asked us to finish our drinks at the bar after only being at the table for an hour and because they said they have another reservation. Oh by the way we had a reservation too.   Hard Pass!

Am6Mt4MbFM2nBuSJ5TDE7w.text: Super fun place with an amazing view of Pittsburgh!  The company was fantastic and the food was delicious.  Great service as well.  I wish we lived closer to this wonderful city!!!   100 A+++

iuXLOjLM9locaIGCYAaLcg.text: if you're going here go for the view, the food is just OK but the view is great. I think a good thing about it, is it's not that expensive compared to other restaurants up there with the same view.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cod Plaki

M_7sLbYmdIPXbg6uIbkdFQ.text: Lets's face it, the real reason to go here is for the view.   The food is just OK and overpriced.  We three stopped for appetizers and drinks in the middle of the afternoon.  The Bloody Mary and the espresso martini were very good.  The glass of Chardonnay, for the price was a lousy pour.  We ordered the coconut shrimp, which was over fried, but fortunately served with a tasty sauce which helped.  We also had the spinach dip, which was served with a great warm pita bread.  The cheese plate had a nice variety of cheese and crackers, served with a spicy mustard sauce.  Overall, nice experience, since we did it for the view, but prices are way high, so not a place I would ever go just to have a meal.

01Z5QiMzTU_ofsDFJY9nyA.text: So where do I start...my ever pressing girlfriend picked this spot for our nye excursion. The menu looked pretty nice online and even had a few more options when we got there. We were quickly seated even without a reservation but unfortunately this is the end of the highlight.   The menus were changed for nye and the options were very limited. Everything was about $15 more expensive and the things I wanted were off the menu. The jalapeno crab dip was exceptional and I wish that is all I ordered.   Our server was ok and wasn't that talkative at all. I had the stuffed shrimp which ended up being just shrimp with crab on top. I had a side of the roasted potatoes. They were only 4......yeah; and they were cold and barely seasoned.   overall it could be a very good restaurant but the portions are very small compared to the price. The experience did not match the price either. If you come back get the jalapeno dip and leave.   The drink menu was very limited also. Not a good look.

owCk9luHmf1JHdKQp-K8fw.text: Its a Saloon first off and yes I like to drink. So that's a win in my book. And they have an incredible view of Pittsburg. A city with way too many bridges. Apparently Pittsburg has two less bridges than Venice but as they say here, " our are made of steel, you know real bridges. Not those small little Venice bridges." Im not really sure what any of this means unless you are holding some contest on bridges which apparently everyone in Pittsburg is.   So the view is unmatched and the drinks are decent. Just get a beer and a shot take your picture and go back down the Incline.

1xveF7PArbtWZ9LtImiHrw.text: I had read several reviews of this place which led me here.  The view is fantastic but that is where it ends. Arrived for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon with a party of 7 including my daughter who attends college in Pittsburgh. Was unable to sit in the main room unless we ordered full entrees which are way overpriced. Even sandwiches are priced above average.  My wife and daughter wanted to share a pizza but was advised that an $8 sharing fee would be applied. For another 6 bucks,  we just ordered another pizza. It was extremely hot as it felt as though the air conditioning was not working.  We were seated far from the windows overlooking the city so my view of the soda machines were awesome.  They have 8 different flavors by the way.   This will be my only trip to the Grandview saloon also called the coal city steakhouse.   Save your money and explore other options.   2 stars is a gift.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xG0Vscg8bvM6-RDNp4CMLQ.text: Great view and I'm sure perfectly fine if you just want some drinks.  But I found the food to be lacking. I ordered the burger (allegedly filet mignon) cooked medium.  It was ABSOLUTELY served to me well done and it was barely seasoned.  The best part of the meal were the french fries, which definitely isn't a good thing. The mushroom soup was also okay, but the portion size was out of control.    The server was very sweet and comped 1/2 the cost of the meal. But I still doubt I'll ever be back.

cHQCQJQhqJNKEzLVD92w1Q.text: Food was excellent!! Pricey but your paying for the view it is one of the best views in town

FZz-4vLhSlt51eoH0UQpwQ.text: I have read numerous reviews of the Grandview Saloon before I decided to take my son there for his birthday. Stupidly, I chose to ignore the reviews and advice of coworkers and head there for the celebration. What a mistake I made! The food was mediocre at best. Our waitress, Danielle was very friendly, which we found out later was tip motivated. My sister and her husband asked for a separate check and Danielle told her it would not be a problem. The prices are outrageous not even justified by the view. First, I ordered the jalapeno crab dip, which had wonderful reviews on trip advisor and yelp. It was good and quite spicy but keep in mind, it is not lump crabmeat. The consistency of the crab appeared ground, which I would compare to canned tuna. I ordered the Prime Steak Sandwich, which was so tough, I had to eat it with a steak knife and fork. My son ordered the Porterhouse steak, which came with asparagus and he chose, fries. He also got a Caesar salad with blackened tuna. He said it was very good but the tuna did not appear to be blackened at all. I was surprised that bread was not served his meal. My husband ordered the jalapeno burger, which was supposed to be topped with battered jalapeno's. The jalapeno's were not battered but appeared to be pulled right out of a can or jar. After we ate, we sat and sat and sat, waiting for Danielle to stop by our table so we could ask for our check. After we asked for our check again, we sat and sat and sat. Finally, we found 30 minutes was entirely too long to wait for our check so, we headed toward the bar and asked the bartender for our check. Danielle then came out from the kitchen and upon seeing us, decided to figure out our check. She gave us our check and when I looked at it, I could not believe how high it was. After scanning the charges, I realized that they had put my sister and husband's meal on our check. I told her that we were to have two checks. She went back to the computerized check/cash register and "supposedly" fixed both of our bills. I paid for our meal, gave her a 20% tip, and we left the restaurant feeling a bit used and unfulfilled by the meal we just ate. While walking to our car, we stopped to read the menu posted outside of the Bella Vista Italian Restaurant. Feeling stupid for choosing the Grandview Saloon over Bella Vista was consuming my thoughts for I had eaten there before and it was truly spectacular. When we got home, my sister took another look at her bill. She discovered that they charged her for some of what me, my husband and son had. Danielle took it upon herself to split the crab dip between the two of us. They did not order the crab dip and had no right to have them pay for half. They also put our soda on their bill. My sister called to tell them about their error. She asked for the manager and told the so-called manager about the bill errors, she put her on hold and put the waitress Danielle on the phone. My sister explained the over charges and Danielle proceeded to argue with her, telling her that her husband did have a soda. My sister told her that her husband had two drafts, no soda. She continued to argue with my sister about her husband having a soda. Her solution was to have me call so I could give her my credit card so that she could bill me for the remaining 1/2 order of the jalapeno dip and credit my sister. We were shocked at this solution. I could not believe that she had the audacity to make this request. This for me, was a first. My sister told her that she was not going to argue with her about the soda. She said okay and hung up. After overhearing this conversation, I decided to call back and let them know what horrible customer service they have. I asked for a manager. Funny, but there were no managers there at that time and would not be until the next day. This made me realize that someone was posing as a manager when my sister called. The following day, I decided to call and talk to a manager. Unfortunately, there were no managers available and instead, I got the bartender supervisor. After telling him everything that had happened, he like Danielle argued with me about my sister's husband getting a soda. I thought to my self, you have got to be kidding me. So, in conclusion is the view good? Everyone talks about the view on the many reviews I read, which is quite nice. But keep in mind, if you sit on the patio, you will be packed in like sardines and unless you sit next to the railing, the view is not that visible. My advice to all of you Mount Washington diners, go somewhere else if you want good food that is worth the money. If you want a view, enjoy the many lookouts across Mount Washington. Don't waste your time or money on the Grandview Saloon.

nmTaerc1rLu-VvCZ1Qb77A.text: The Grandview Saloon revels in the real estate phrase "location, location, location". The facility itself could use a decoration update but has an amazing view of downtown Pittsburgh.  It has indoor and outdoor seating high above the city.  Other reviewers seem to be expecting a finer dining establishment than the Saloon offers. The prices are a bit higher but again the location fee is built into your meal. I shared the pulled pork nachos with my companions and was pleasantly surprised by the dish.  We had a couple of drinks on a weekend afternoon after a ride up the Duquesne incline.  I'd recommend it for the view and a snack.

Saf-t5AkKHdH9WH6mz7i3A.text: Not a great place at all. Applebee's quality food and way to much in price for that quality. Had to try it, not coming back.

1ae89wplYI1NU0PHRRgz8w.text: The food is low quality, and for such high prices, that is unacceptable. The view is great, but you can get that and good food at the other restaurants on this street.

_y-ouqrBpD55i1D3_nSUag.text: OH MY GAWD. I am giving 5 stars just for the view. Its beatutiful and  so romantic. Infact while we were dining there, a guy was proposing to his girlfriend sitting on the window table. They have three levels, with level 1 having an outdoor seating as well and the whole restaurant overlooks the whole Pittsburgh downtown. There are couple of other restuarants I am guessing with similar view.  Anyway, I had the sausage hogie which is chefs special and loved it. I think everyone in Pittsburgh or visiting Pittsburgh must visit this place once, but remember to make a reservation for the windows seats. They are in high demand.

tXjdXpbXKthMnJr_FpyEVg.text: What a great place for newcomers to Pittsburg. You certainly get a grand view and the food is delicious. We rode the incline which was a hoot tooI had the cream of gourmet mushroom soup and the french fry salad - apparently a new tradition in Pittsburgh or Penn. in general? Odd combination, but so were chicken wings and bbq sauce in Buffalo in the 70s! My husband had the sausage sub -- to fat to pick up! We were there early on a Saturday on a chilly day in April and could just imagine how fun it would be to eat outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. the river activity was fun to watch - the water levels rising as spring thaws and rains were plentiful.
Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. french fry salad with beef
Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sausage sub and slaw

zvTFTIiE66fOGb4dGZyokg.text: worth it just for the view!  It's just to your left after you get off the Duquesne Incline.  Go at sunset!

0skWU7rHVrhTDGXnpQ2jMQ.text: One of the worst meals I've had in a long time. Tuna was ordered medium rare, came out medium well. Pasta WAY overcooked. Do not need to ever come back. Plenty of other restaurants on Mt Washington.

sAEz6NdMR8ThnlURsFvBQQ.text: I grew up in Pittsburgh and now live in Georgia.  When I come home I quite often make a trip up the Duquesne incline and eat at the Grandview Saloon.  So, when I was on an executive board that was planning a conference in Pittsburgh and we needed a cool place to take 35 life members for lunch I immediately thought of the Grandview saloon.   The all glass front overlooking the Point and three rivers convergence is spectacular in itself.    Sue was great to work with from the start.   The day arrived and everything was perfect!   The food was excellent.  The group had Reuben's, crab cakes, fried Cod sandwiches, pear salads, etc.   EVERYTHING was excellent to a tee! Not one complaint from this vocal group!  The only thing I'd change was the requirement of one check for the group   Since we were doing this dutch treat This could have been a nightmare (I brought extra cash just in cash we were short). But we came out within 60 cents of the total bill!  That was a first! (Grin)   I was so pleased I brought the executive board back for dinner on Friday night to celebrate a successful conference. The brightly lit city was beautiful, Including a full moon which i ordered just for us!  Again, it was excellent with no complaints from this very tired group!   Crab cakes, gyros, Reuben's, Etc were all good.  The mushroom soup was a Gilled masterpiece, that with a salad, could have been a meal in itself.  We had two waiters for the 35 people and they kept in top of things well!   Couldn't have asked for a better experience either time!   I won't hesitate to go back next time im in town!

sMMcwM5ki9tWAIyquDIg2A.text: Scenario: you walk out of the Duquesne Incline and need a place to eat. Turn and take about 20 steps. Walk into the Grandview Saloon. Go upstairs for an awesome view by the window, or downstairs for a more informal, outdoor setting. Great food with rare, great prices up here. Definitely recommend!

19-2rGMEKW8g8RCzDIi1zw.text: Best view of any bar restaurant in the world.  Terrible decor and average food. Looks like a high school kids basement. I do believe this place needs John Taffer and bar rescue BAD. Come here for apps and beer and bring a camera

jLruMyfrded5bKurgUulew.text: Sat on the outdoor patio on a clear, sunny day and enjoyed a stunning view of downtown Pittsburg above the converging rivers. The calamari was good, suggested that an option of sauce be offered. The remoulade sauce which came with my grandson's crab cake sandwich was terrific with the calamari!

YnQs37eunTQJP8KlWmqz6g.text: One helluva view and fantastic jalapeno crab dip.  Pair it with some ice cold beer and this place is sure to be a hit during the summer time!

Gqql4kFbqAPqdJhfYFaLCg.text: Simple food that takes an extremely long time to arrive. We had the slowest service I can remember. Moreover, it was pretty crappy, unapologetic service. I'll never go back. It's simply not worth it.

2e6DIviiECQ3phuuvcn-Rw.text: Everybody suggested that we go to this restaurant for the view. I should have realized that nobody talked about the food. The drinks are weak and way overpriced. The staff are mostly yongsters who are pleasant but young. The place is clearly understaffed. The bartenders are horrible, the food is average and the place is expensive. I would go up to the mountain, take some photos and leave.

9j1Jtz1Bht3bVAChpFKBfA.text: We went back before another Steeler game and this time I got the crab-cake sandwich. Awesome is the only word to describe it. And did I mention the view???

kBNsFcAMZP5VpY9lHZdr0Q.text: We celebrated our daughters graduation this past sunday and were very happy to have chosen the Grandview Saloon.  Our waitress Megan,  did a great job at keeping 11 of us happy for dinner.  I have to say that we tried at least 6 different meals and each and every one was presented beautifully, and tasted just as good.  We were very happy with our food.  Just wonder if people in pittsburgh don't drink pinot grigio..  or everyone does...  as  we drank their last 2 bottles.  The view was awesome as well.  I wanted to be sure and write a positive review..  thanks for taking care of us.

dQNVr8h9THPBfr1vAyVQFQ.text: I really wanted to love this place! VERY RARELY DO I GIVE A NOT SO FLATTERING REVIEW BUT:  I called for a reservation and the man that answered the phone was extremely nice. He told me the Patio Seating was first come/first serve. Since it has been inclement weather, I got a reservation for window seating for 7PM. When we arrived, the Hostess told us our table would be ready in a few minutes. She came into the bar to tell us it would be a little longer. That was fine. The view is gorgeous and we took some beautiful pictures of Pittsburgh. The Hostess brought us to our table and that's when everything went SOUTH. Our Waitress, Kayla, wanted to go home apparently. She asked if we were OK with water (that was already on our table) but we wanted a drink from the bar and to enjoy the moment.  We lived in Pittsburgh for a while and we were back in town to do some renovations. We worked very hard for over a month and this was to celebrate our hard work was finally finished. Kayla brought our drinks, asked if we were ready to order...we knew we wanted the French Onion Soup (DELICIOUS) so we started with that. She came out of the kitchen with a tray on her shoulder and our soup in her hand. As she passed our table, she handed the soup to my husband and kept going. Well OK, she had her hands full but this isn't Carson Street!!  My husband had a few sips and passed it to me to try when Kayla walked over and asked if we were ready to order our food yet. I had just taken one spoonful of the soup and I said no but my husband said yes...Kayla ignored me so he ordered. (What waitress takes an order when the entire party isn't ready? Yes, there were only two of us but 50% of us were not ready. OK move on!) By this time, I was getting upset since we came for a nice relaxing evening only to be rushed. We ordered the $50. Porterhouse Steak (MEH- just OK, not  what I was hoping for) and a Crab Cake sandwich (since there is an $8.00 Sharing charge we got both items). I caught her on her way by to ask for some bread. When she brought it, she asked "How is your food tasting?" WHAT? Who says that? Then she started sweeping the carpet around us while we were eating. GROSS!! Our bill was well over $150.00 after parking and the bar bill. I asked for a doggy bag for the steak bone and Kayla handed me a little styrofoam box. I asked her if she had anything bigger but no. Weird...you sell a 24 oz. Porterhouse. It is such a shame that this one waitress spoiled the whole experience. If she wanted to go home she should have gone! Is there any FINE DINING in Pittsburgh?? Kayla should work on Carson Street where no one cares if you sweep under their feet. We thought this would be special but it was very disappointing...and all because we had a rude waitress. Too Bad! My husband still tipped her, his usual, over 20% because he worked in the restaurant industry. The thing is, even though we don't live here anymore, we still have a voice; Thanks to Yelp!! Also, we don't have small kids but if you do: ASK ABOUT THE NO KIDS POLICY BEFORE YOU GO!! I gave them 3 Stars...one for the guy on the phone, one for the Hostess and one for the view!

tmBv0AVqUSSy_wZW6EVQwg.text: Five girlfriends and I chose this restaurant as the starting point for a "girls night out" mostly because we wanted the view of Mt. Washington and the experience of riding the incline to/from and it was less expensive and more casual than many other restaurants on Grandview Ave. Well, it's True what they say - you get what you pay for. In general, this place seems to be confused about its persona. It kind of WANTS to be a fancy restaurant with the white linen tablecloths and tiny candle lamps on the tables, but there is very little ambiance beyond the view of downtown Pittsburgh. Even the menu is confusing. There seems to be a strange mix of "fancy" dishes and more low-key items such as sandwiches and wraps. The latter would seem appropriate on a lunch menu, but for dinner, I think they should stick to seafood and pasta, and apparently steak, since it's technically a steak house, or at least was in the recent past. (I don't eat steak, so if it was on the menu, I would've skiipped right past it anyway.) The menu was also small - perhaps only 15-20 total choices? Not one person at my table said that they LOVED their meal, leaving me to conclude that they don't really put much effort into their offerings. In my opinion, if you're going to have a limited menu, that's fine - choose a few select dishes and do them REALLY well. A smattering of mediocre choices does not make up for the rest that this place is lacking. Our server was very personable, but I believe overworked, (which is hard to understand, since the place isn't very big), which lead to an overall impression of not-that-great service. We had to wait quite a while for drinks, had to ask for the complimentary bread that we spied on other tables, and had to ask to have our tabletop candle lamp lit at dusk. Turns out, there wasn't even a candle in it - apparently they're just set on the tables for show. He did, however, graciously take back a glass of wine one friend did not like and replaced it with a much better selection. And upon overhearing another friend complain about not even being able to cut her tuna steak with a butter knife (it should not need a knife at all), he offered to have the kitchen prepare her a new meal and asked to take back the half of hers that was overdone so they could see just what was wrong with it. Overall, I will not be in a hurry to go back to this place for anything other than drinks on the outside patio if I happen to be in the area.

jqcwR7bUmCVpAy_bIu_JMA.text: I do love this venue so very much.  There are other restaurants nearby to overlook the city from Mt. Washington, but this one is affordable and has outdoor seating.    On this particular Sunday, we travelled up the Monongahela Incline, and walked the approximately one mile to this restaurant next to the Duquesne Incline as we like the viewing stands near the Monongahela but like this particular restaurant to enjoy the view.    It was surprising that at 11:50am on a Sunday with high 70's temperatures and partly sunny skies, there was not one person already outside on the terrace.  For that matter, there was not one person inside on that level, either.  No matter.  Good for us to have our choice of tables right next to the rail and views.  Our server was attentive, pleasant, and efficient without being intrusive to our chatter and experience.  As usual, we brought an out-of-town guest here to bask in the Pittsburgh scenery.  We opted for drinks and appetizers this go-round and they all hit the spot and were both flavorful and eye-catching.  We ordered some hummus and pita, as well as the jalapeno crab dib and pita.  Definitely winners.

mlf2LAd-560WJgrdsyVzvA.text: My steak was delicious. I ate the whole thing, but a lot of that had to do with the fact that I was there for about 3:30. The service was terrible. Took 30+ mins to get drinks, when they arrived they were wrong, and the waitress somehow didn't come back for another twenty minutes after.   I was with a party of 12, and I was the only one who got what they ordered (which I'm not complaining about). I've worked in a lot of kitchen settings in the past, so I get it. A cook could have quit, a waitress could have no showed, or anythin in between. But it definitely felt like a real lack of effort anyhow.   Will not return, although you cannot beat the 5-star view.

WFvEf8YBMz6BR7BNOmxKvA.text: The outdoor views from the deck are unparalleled - but the decor is seriously dated and somewhat dirty. Under the right management, they could crush it with locals and tourists. In fact, that's the case with the few neighborhood restaurant venues - they don't capitalize on the location.  That said, a must stop for drinks on the deck. Food is OK.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great views.

BnQCt3NAPszVXl6vUqohHg.text: It was difficult to get someone to take our order, then after about 45 min our food arrived cold.  We sent it back and about 20 min later it came back about a third of the original portion and full of salt.  The view of Pittsburg was beautiful and the best part of the night

W_tBJBaLLwzIBihb3_VHwQ.text: Visiting Pittsburgh...great food and great service... have the Colossal Crab Cake Sandwhich...it really is Colossal  and DELICIOUS

_ZwS94uNq5qlrOIn4hCX9g.text: The view is fantastic, and the steak was ok.  My colleagues had terrible food.  The Buffalo calamari was so salty it could not be eaten by two of the people with me.  The coconut shrimp was burnt and cold.  The service was absolutely terrible, and I don't know why, because they weren't that crowded.  Will I come back?  Yes, because I want to give them another chance. I was here a couple of years ago, and had a much better experience.

MPJQ5AO9eH9pjBBlb2hK3A.text: First the good news:  we walked in and got 2 seats at the corner of the downstairs bar.  Now the bad: My wife's Cosmo was warm, maybe because it sat too long before the bartender served it.  It tasted as if it were missing ingredients, such as liqueur and lime. My basil gimlet was the worst I've ever had.  It wasn't cold, and tasted like basil flavored water.  I watched the bartender muddle the basil, but couldn't see what else he was doing since he was mixing at the back of the bar.  He let it sit while he did other things at the bar and out on the deck.  I asked him if it was still cold-he said "yes." All in all, I made 2 mistakes: 1) I didn't watch to make sure he added gin, lime, and syrup. 2) I didn't send the drink back. I won't make the mistake of going back.

ARwGtalsaav2xhr4uozhxw.text: Hubby and I played tourist when his parents came to town. We rode the Duquesne incline up from Station Square and nabbed the last table by the windows, even though we didn't have a reservation. The wait staff seemed harried but nice. We enjoyed our pear and spinach salads (MIL didn't like the dressing as much as I did), Rueben, and burger. The fries in particular were a big hit. Prices are a little high, but that goes with the view. We may come back in the summer to sit out on the deck.

I_euAv8MSjBB_IaCrncJ9Q.text: With a deck location and a view of the city this good I didn't expect a whole lot from the menu offerings but boy was I wrong. We were there for lunch. We sat outside on the deck. We ordered the Grandview gyro, made not from gyro meat but from slow roasted leg of lamb. The gyro was wonderful. The Tzaziki  sauce fresh made. Unbelievably flavourful. We also had a Ruben sandwich. Thick sliced marble   piled high with lean corned beef, sauerkraut and topped with thousand island dressing. We also had a bowl of tomato bisque. Thick and creamy. The Grandview lives up to its name but also has great menu offerings.

qywBvfRw6EDgAnKUNn9x7Q.text: No way this is a $$ restaurant, I pay $45.00 for a bad stake, appetizer wasn't  grate ,it looks outdated inside, but the waiter was good guy :) that's why I give them 2  star :)

-5uuZf6-uHlD3c7YFEwLPQ.text: Where do I even start with this review..... Coming from out of town, I made reservations a couple weeks in advance because it's new years weekend. They moment I walked into the restaurant my first thought was "am I in a Chinese restaurant"? The set up makes no sense! Why you would have an "upscale" restaurant with sketchy random cabinets that almost look like they are in a laundromat in the middle of the room with multiple guest tables and bright florescent lighting is beyond me..... As my group sat down by the window with a great view, they all made similar comments. We decided to give it a try and not judge a book by its cover. That is until our waiter came..... Jesus Christ, I wish I would have got this guy's name because he should definitely choose a different career and the owner needs to know that! From the get go, he was so rude. We orders waters while we all looked at the menu for other drinks. Great job by him, he brought the waters quickly. But that's about where his good service stopped. We asked for a couple more minutes to review the menu and he gave us exactly one minute. He seemed very irritated. After we told him to give us more time he came back within literally seconds and at this point we started to get frustrated with him. He asked him a couple of questions about the restaurant and then asked for 5 more minutes for our group of 5 to review the menu more. He gave us about 30 seconds this time. At this point we got up and left. When we told him why we were leaving he said "good because I was tired anyways".... Are you Fu**ing kidding me!? Awful service and unfortunately we didn't get to taste the food or the drinks. From that experience I will never be back nor will I recommend this restaurant. Plenty of other good places to visit.

G3vAOskHUbYD974x_PuF-A.text: The view from this place is to die for. I expected the food and drinks to be mediocre because they have that view but the cucumber basil gimlet was fresh and fantastic, Greek salad, chips and gyro were quite good. Service was friendly and fast. Highly recommend this place.

Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek salad. With all the stuff I love
Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gyro and maybe the best chips anywhere - they are crispy and taste like potatoes!

QfXudV8Qt6D8OEhdfTtlPQ.text: Good casual place on the mountain if you are not in the mood for a fancy dinner. Always like their steak sandwiches. I think it is 12oz ny steak with sweat potato fries! Nacho is good too.

6MZPiDNYcQTKgxqgAiiF4A.text: Couldn't get my tripod over the lookout deck, so figured we would have a few bites and a stable places for my camera for pics of pittsburgh.   If you go during a weekday, we went on tuesday... there will be plenty of space out on the balcony. Sadly my pics didn't come out that great cause when someone walked, it shook the balcony slightly. Not good for long exposures. But... had a great view anyways.   we had a few sodas and a salad. A bit more expensive, but considering the view... i'm suprised it didn't cost more.   The staff were super friendly. I look foward to going back!

dptVPoQeEeOfjPtFeU4WCQ.text: A great place with a lovely view. This place is slightly expensive, but the given the view of the city and the quality of food delivered by them, it is totally worth the money. I tried the salmon stuffed with crab for the first time. I would definitely try that again. The bread they serve (which is complementary) was warm and it looked like it came straight from the oven. Loved the experience.

4ktf2HZ88rvmL-SJi3I3wQ.text: Beautiful view of the city but food and service were just ok.  Server not knowledgeable about menu.  Food was salty too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from restaurant on a rainy day!

aDUC7AUTlezNAWgNdt155g.text: The view is wonderful, but for something on Mount Washington, with Mount Washington prices, I definitely had higher expectations. I came here with a party of seven last night, we ordered two bottles of the house white and a couple glasses of the white sangria, pulled pork nachos and calamari to start off with.   I wasn't too hungry, so I thought I would get the "artisanal cheese and fruit plate". Cheese plates are my default choice at somewhat upscale-restaurants. To my dismay, this is what I received: cheddar cubes, old/brown grapes and a hunk of greek yogurt cheese. Unacceptable. Only come to the Grandview Saloon for the view and overpriced drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Artisanal cheese plate&#34;. Beware: this place is delusional.

qZpqQQsR1iq9ZDxS0ntiwg.text: Order was disappointing. Service wasn't around for awhile. Taste is very plain. Fancy on the menu but horrible in person. What was suppose to be a flat bread with fancy cheeses for $12 is a cheaply made pizza with canned tomatoes and kraft Parmesan. See pic.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. What was suppose to be a flat bread with fancy cheeses for $12 is a cheaply made pizza with canned tomatoes and kraft Parmesan.

wqag3r5VVvYsAXQOphKCuw.text: Stopped in here for a Christmas dinner with family. The dining area is separated by an upstairs and a downstairs area. We sat in the downstairs area which was awesome because we where right up against the window, and that's what really sets this place up.  The views of the city at night are absolutely amazing! We had a larger group of ten but the waitress was great and handled it with ease. She kept the drinks flowing and everyone was happy. The food was great and everyone at the table liked what they had. My wife splurged and got the New York strip. It was pricey but she absolutely loved it. I had the stuffed chicken Parmesan and it was delicious.   The only complaint we had was the the bar downstairs was closed. Not the worst but would have been nice to stay after the meal and have a few drinks.

pKlnK8OgaVNXtlXPE08cYQ.text: I have dined here on several occasions and the food was just as spectacular as the view..however yesterday's visit really fell short of my expectations. It seems this establishment is suffering from inexperience in both the wait and kitchen staff during our late afternoon visit (4:00 P.M.) Our Jalepeno Crab Dip appetizer was delicious and served in a timely manner..but our French Onion soup never arrived! Our dinners were sub-par.  My husband's Pittsburgh Chicken Salad arrived with a live fruit fly, but being a guy he just removed it rather than wait for a replacement...gross! This made me question the kitchen conditions. My burger was not prepared as ordered, med. well..it was very well done and dry. After asking the waiter twice for ketchup it finally arrived, on the upside the onion rings were hot and delicious. Our guest who requested a return visit to this establishment couldn't wait to order the spectacular Seafood Scampi... she was solely disappointed with her choice on this visit..although the seafood in the dish was prepared to perfection...the scampi sauce was pasty and the pasta was over cooked. nothing like the delightful dish she experienced on her last visit. It was a huge disappointment at a premium price!  I will think twice about revisiting the Grandview Saloon...hopefully they can get their act together again!

p6et6rCiDp4YLTEaKkjHKA.text: Where do I start...well it's a so out dated for the price of food here. It is dirty and very cheaply furnished. They say formal dress and no kids under 6. People in t shirts and kids running around.  The glasses for water, they were dirty. Silverware...dirty. Fuzz on the wood around the cast iron plate for the steak. The steak....terribly prepared. They claim to be a steak house but I've had better at Texas Roadhouse... Pretty sad. The view is beautiful however.

Wxl_cK1l2VH-GCugdz7jtg.text: Would give it zero stars if possible.  Two of our party got sick within an hour of eating there.  When we called to inform them that something was off the person who answered the phone was extremely rude and implied it was impossible to prove anything and if we were unsatisfied to go on yelp. So here you go.  Average food at above average prices based solely on location is not enough. Enough other choices in the area. Avoid patronizing an establishment that doesn't value their customers

9RHJUW4O_Y_o138kws4mWw.text: Made reservation by phone and told them I had a child. I spent $10 on parking and $20 on incline ride to the top of Mount Washington. When I arrived they told me that they do not allow children under 6 in their restaurant. Keep in mind, this was not on their website and I made a reservation for 4 adults and a child and they never asked me her age. It was 7:30, I was on top of a mountain with my family on a Saturday night with no other dining options. They wouldn't consider seating us. These are really bad people. I have never heard of a restaurant not allowing children. I suppose they don't have it on their website because people would think that they are horrible people who hate children which they apparently are. I am sure that their inflexible and unfair treatment of customers is apparent in other aspects of their business as is pretty apparent in all of their other bad reviews.

oX_1c_DWA2tLhB1Ix8Ym3w.text: We had reservations for over 2 weeks. We arrived ON TIME for our table. We were told it would be 30-45 min because the kitchen and bar were "slammed". Not my prob. What's the point of a reservation? Never going back.

4N2Tkc2wHEZqEIi3jQzCLA.text: The restaurant upstairs is horrid. Chrome tables and chairs, overpriced non imaginative food, dirty carpet, and slovenly service. The bar is ok if you stick with sandwiches and appetizers. Had an excellent steak sandwich the other day, however I was appalled by a notation on the menu that they charge $12 to split a meal. Go to Altius if you want an awesome dinner, or to Vue 412 for lunch.  Avoid...they have changed their dinner menu. No longer can you get a sandwich for dinner in the bar...you have to order off of their overpriced dinner menu....iffy food, inflated prices and awful service. Prices for mediocre food are comparable to those at Altius

H4DVeLJuPVrCmtC8iYyLFg.text: Unfathomably awful. If you like flushing your money away and being embarrassed, take your family here. Atmosphere is like a papa Johns. Loud kitchen machinery, outdated, old cheap furniture, food service took 1.5 hours to get out! Food was literally deplorable. Potatoes had no butter salt or flavor, $49 filet was drenched in brown gravy rather than seared. Portions were small, dry, and overcooked. Literally wish there was a zero star option. And all that for $250. Wish I would have gone to Denny's.

M03PRgfMTtdOezQ81USzBw.text: My favorite restaurant to eat at on Mount Washington.  There are a few reasons for this.  First, this place doesn't pretend to be something its not.  It is not as ritzy as the Lemont or somewhere similar, so if that is what you are expecting, you will be disappointed.  My wife and I are both too loud to enjoy places like that anyways.  However, we do enjoy good food and a good atmosphere.  We like places that have bar food, but sometimes want something a little better.  This place is perfect for that.    Another one of my favorite things about the place is how diverse the menu is.  It is rare to find a place that has a menu with both a $12 sandwich and a $50 steak.  Whether you want a juicy steak or a simple sandwich, everything is prepared wonderfully and tastes great.  Some of my favorite things to get here are the buffalo chicken dip, buffalo chicken sandwich, grandview burger, Crab sandwich, and the ribeye filet.  I have never been disappointed with any meal here.  On top of the great food, you cannot beat the atmosphere, especially in the summer when the decks are open.  The views are amazing and make for a great experience.

4p7WpZY7AuasEgBM3efKkA.text: No small children under the age of 6? Seriously, I have never even heard of that. We went for lunch because it was the only place for lunch with a view. Turned out to be a giant waste of time. Too bad because the place was empty. Took our business elsewhere

T7JjhWWw0fDAWOqcCtRcXw.text: The very best filet I have EVER had!  Breathtaking views.  My husband had the rib eye and could not stop raving about it!  Large portions, good service!   We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

G3mvF_78jyemWeunABfTbA.text: The deck at Grandview Saloon has the best view of the city for sure!! I will only go if I can sit outside, and I will only go for drinks only. I actually ate before I left the house because I knew I didn't want to eat there lol. The food is not that great, but it is very expensive. $14 for a burger and $19 for a crab dip appetizer! You also have to hike up 2 flights of stairs to get to the restrooms. Also, this place can be hard to find because the outside is labeled Coal Hill Steakhouse... not Grandview Saloon (not sure what that's about lol) However, I still had a nice time on the deck! I was there with a party of 10 and the service was very good! The tables are bolted to the deck so we couldn't move them, but we kept taking chairs and moving them around a big table, and no one seemed to mind. There was a team of 2 servers, and they both worked diligently to refill our waters and replace our beers!  I'm sure I will be spending many summer afternoons to come on the deck of Grandview Saloon!

a9mvleO_0Vf6W_1vEsmvag.text: BEAUTIFUL VIEWS. Food was also super good while the vegan options are pretty limited. I made it work with a modified salad, which was GREAT. The prices are on the high side, but for that view, it was totally worth it. The inside could use some updating, but it totally fits the Pittsburgh vibe. This was my second visit, and I'll be back! The only bad thing is the terrifying drive up! Being from the Midwest, I'm not accustomed to those steep streets. I wouldn't do it in the winter. If it's a nice day out, I highly suggest parking below and taking the incline railroad up!

ig-z3GJVYmCxDzOAR15ZaQ.text: The view is AMAZING! It's perfect for drinks with a view of Pittsburgh. I had the gyro and it was good, but it could be better. I found the food to be a little over priced. The staff was great though - especially the bar tender. I would suggest this as a place to get a cocktail, but not for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SyySbwD7iZqUeCgKp4MueQ.text: Was very pleased with the service and view from the restaurant. Only reason it received a four instead of a five was the spinach and artichoke dip barely had any spinach and was made of very very large pieces of artichoke. Our main dishes were very well prepared.

lX4eQB743J08jWgT6BicBw.text: Get ready for this review. My party had made a reservation here for prom night (remember this) because of the stellar view and the expectation that the food would be relatively cheaper than that of the surrounding restaurants. First off, when we arrived at the restaurant, it was empty in the upstairs dining room, yet they still would not seat our entire party together, despite the fact that there was clearly plenty of room. The restaurant in general felt off to me, as the furniture was outdated, tacky, and basic. There were several bugs flying about as well, which would be unsettling for any diner. The silverware was clearly not entirely clean, as it appeared smudged, and mine had traces of crumbs and other food particles on it. The options on the menu seemed decent, but they were EXTREMELY overpriced for the actual quality of the food. In that moment, I thought to myself how we could have dined at one of the luxury restaurants in the surrounding area for approximately the same price, but much higher quality food. HERE IS WHERE IT GETS GROSS, SAD, AND SHAMEFUL!!! We arrived at the prom and had only been there about 15 minutes before someone in our party threw up multiple times, and another one began to have stomach pains. Unfortunately, due to the low quality and disgusting food at this establishment, she had to leave her senior prom before the night even took off. The next morning, another person in our party was complaining of extreme stomach pains and fear of vomit to come. That is when we decided to call the restaurant to let them know of this incident, and potentially ask for some money back, as each couple had to pay $80 for food poisoning. When we called (multiple of us did), the staff was incredibly rude, stating that we could not claim they suffered from a food illness unless they went to the hospital. They also claimed that the health inspector "was just there" without giving any specific dates. They were not understanding or sympathetic towards our situation, and instead tried to make themselves the victims in this situation. We will NEVER EVER return to this establishment, instead we will remember it as the place that ruined prom! Please, don't come here, spare your wallets, pride, and stomachs :)

wBwLuoX4UmGSuRCUryN-fA.text: If I could give this less than one start I would. Our waitress Brittany was rude from the beginning, she did not introduce herself, sat down two waters and walked away after we said we didn't want a menu. After ordering an appetizer and dinner the service unfortunately went downhill even more. When we asked to speak to the manager her response was "this is what you get" meaning herself. We were able to speak to the bar manager who was argumentative and aggressive towards us. As a previous restaurant employee I can tell you firsthand that should not be tolerated. After explaining for the third time the reasons we were unhappy we were told we could pay the bill and take the food to go. After some more go around the untouched food was comped and we paid for our appetizer and left. But not before being threatened to have the police come because we were refusing to pay. I kindly explained I'm more than happy to pay for the food we consumed and that wasn't good enough. All in all I'd say if you're looking for a place with a truly great view, go here. But if service, hospitality or respect from management or staff is important find another establishment to go to immediately

RZctn7pGWarNXp-n8DctMQ.text: This is my favorite place in the entire city. The view is breathtaking and the food is even better, the Belgium waffles are 10/10 recommend for breakfast/brunch (but I gotta say everything else looked amazing). The service was amazing, we were seated very quickly and the food came really fast. The waiter kept checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. I'm definitely going to come back here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-DmnkIBLoIK2q_mZ5qhepA.text: The buffalo calamari was great for an app.  I would skip the salads and jump into an entree and cocktails.  Portions are big so you could almost order an appetizer and 1 entree and split it. Food prices are high for the restaurant but you are paying for the amazing views over the city.  $7 for top shelf alcohol is worth it.  Nothing fancy but a nice place to chill and even better when you can sit out on the patio.

bI-HzAJ9lw7mfL7dob0gjA.text: Teach staff how Guinness should be poued please. youtu.be/x6pgAcU8DBA Sitting the glass on the counter under the tap and pouring straight doen, tisk tisk

xz7uiVHwFsA_xg_CMdfeQA.text: WHAT A VIEW!   Sunset here is beyond words. Especially when paired with a local beer. When it gets dark, go inside for some spicy crab dip. It is a little expensive, but very tasty. Just what a chilly night in Mt. Washington deserves!  I did not go to the main restaurant, but it looked really busy when I left.  The location could not be better (right next to the D. incline.)

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing view with great local beer selection!

VmPMjkbOYj4GcKkng6B5Og.text: Grandview salon is a solid spot on the Mount.  The food selection leaves a little something to be desired. They have a menu that needs a overhaul. This place could do spot better in that regard.  To talk about the positive points of the place:  1) location - right in Grandview near the incline. Night spot for a drink/lunch/dinner.  2) wait staff - friendly and attentive  3) the view - you have a world class view of the downtown/north shore area.  In my opinion nice spot for a happy hour drink but I would grab food elsewhere.

9hZLKInNv-Bmj6PLKVePuw.text: We spent a warm spring afternoon on the patio enjoying a couple of beers and having some light lunch.  I think for both items, this was a decent spot.  Good service, reasonable prices and great views of the skyline.  It's almost right beside the incline, so you don't have to walk far to enjoy the view after you head up the hill.  On a sunny day, this was perfect.

Y6gs-2W_GvWppPiZEW0qNA.text: Horrible management and no structure at all in this place. The service needs much improvement.  My girlfriend and I sat down at 8pm for dinner and enjoyed the view for 20 minutes before our waiter JT came over to take our drink orders. We ordered caprese and french onion soup to start.  The pesto caprese was good but the slices of tomatoes were uneven cut (wedge cut), staked on top of eachother so the balsamic wasnt even on the bottom two slices of tomatoes. Great flavor but shit presentation.  I returned the french onion soup because it was unbelievably salty. Fyi I put salt on top of everything that my gf and grandma tell at me so when I say its salty.... it's pretty bad! 930 our food finally arrived at our table and we took 3 bits and asked for a box because we were so feed up with our lack of service and long wait. This place needs a strong manager because whoever is doing the job now is not doing a great job. He or she should be fired for running the place the way they do.  If you are the owner please respond and I will help you get your restuarant running the way it should be. You could have a gold mine but not with your management or the salt problem you have in the kitchen.

4_E2DRPKV1o9H4BNorfH_w.text: What a crap show.  Slow service, bad food, high prices, and a view.  The view is the only thing this college bar wannabe joint has going for it.  When you walk in all you smell is the beer soaked carpets.  The water tasted like it came out of the hose and the iced tea was even worse.  Waited about 90 minutes for the "food" which consisted of a mix of stale french fries and a burnt $28 steakburger.  I wish I read the Yelp reviews before I wasted my time and money on this ridiculously bad establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is what a $20 something burnt burger looks like.

PhHkI9LGK_sieuHNVIijPw.text: The view is incredible here. It's worth the ride up the Duquesne incline to have a bite to eat and a drink. We had the Italian wedding soup that was good, the chicken wings were good, Buffalo wrap was good, and the cheese steak was also good. Can't beat the view.

29hgc1KcVdiVMzehsPnIbQ.text: I got something to say! I hate your service today! * Glen Danzig voice*. But no seriously, downstairs service sucks.  John is cool, he was a good server but the girls downstairs were non existent for prolonged periods of time and were lazy and rude.  So if you're into overpriced things that piss you off, this is your spot.  I've been a bartender for years and this was next level. I mean, I'm yelping.  Also, the establishment seems to have its very own  Yelp troll loser that has nothing but free time and will harass you if you leave an honest review.

J0hlXwCBhOT-qXBDMH8ayA.text: My husband and I went up the Duquesne Incline on a Thursday morning, and after we got to the top we were looking for a lunch spot. Checked on Yelp and found the Grandview Saloon.  I was so happy to find this place. The weather was perfect, and we ended up sitting outside, with a spectacular view of Pittsburgh. It was fantastic.!  After a quick look at the menu we decided on the poached pear salad for myself and the grilled Grecian wrap for my husband. I couldn't think of two better on trays for a perfect summer day. My salad had poached pears, gorgonzola, and pecans topped with a vinaigrette that was delicious. Very fresh and healthy option. My husband's wrap was full of Mediterranean style chicken, feta cheese and a tzatziki sauce. It was actually quite large, definitely big enough for an adult male.   There were a lot of servers coming in and out to help us on the patio, we never felt neglected out there like sometimes happens at other restaurants. Looking forward to bringing one of my girlfriends here for lunch in the near future.

etP_LCMV8hMxk8tEWKD4_Q.text: Food was excellent. The piece of fish for the fish & chips was HUGE! My friends had the Ahi Tina, steakburger, and gyros. Plates were empty when we finished. Travis was our server originally and he was great at pointing out highlights of the view from the outdoor porch. He was very friendly and helpful. After he was off, the guy who took over also was knowledgeable about the city. All staff were friendly.

PyLa6bVLJgVAjVSNKQ-nUg.text: I hope everyone reads this post before going to this restaurant. My husband called before we got there and they stated they had a place on the patio open. It was a nice night in Pittsburgh and we wanted to go out to eat since my husband recently got cleared from his NHL Cancer diagnosis. We drove up to Mt Washinton and went into the restaurant to meet a very rude woman. She stated that at 730pm at night that we would not be able to eat due to only having one cook. They would not seat us and stated that the wait for food would be 1.5 hours and then they would be closed. I then said that we called 15 minutes prior and she stated that we could come in. We were willing to sit on the porch and wait as long as it took for the food to come out... we were in NO rush. They said they would not be able to serve us even in 1.5 hours with very minimal patrons in the  restaurant. I would like the owner of the restaurant to know this happened with his/her staff. Very unprofessional. The woman proceeded to tell us that we were not welcomed in the restaurant. "She didn't need us here." We will not be going back either.  This happened on 9.17.19.

zMpYGJCIs0YXWkjp1e4Msg.text: If you are seated near a window or on the patio, the views are worth the trip. The food was okay but very expensive. We were there on a fairly busy Saturday night and it was SO LOUD that we could barely hear each other when talking across the table. I recommend going here to grab a drink and to take in the view but I'd get dinner elsewhere.

-ce0WMpZbhd2fUfOWux5cg.text: Beautiful view, but the interior was not nearly as impressive. When you enter, the hosts station is a awkwardly placed in a hallway in a doorway to the kitchen. You then go to the restaurant floor which has beautiful view of downtown Pittsburgh, but the walls are covered with weird murals of Pittsburgh sports photos blown up to giant size. And then one wall has an ugly drink station with beat up cabinets that's always in view.  Food was okay, but was quite expensive for the quality. You're paying for the food, not food quality unfortunately.  Overall I think this place would be setup better as a bar - something where they could $12 for a rum and coke and you could lean back and enjoy the view of Pittsburgh and talk with friends.

zUewr1eQLUpzbSzi5qnkZA.text: The view is second to none. That being said this place is a little bit of a novelty because of it. The food is not the focus here. It is a place you come to eat something and enjoy the VIEW.   We ordered some sandwiches and although they werent terrible... but they werent anything to write home about. The grilled cheese and tomato bisque was bland the tomato bisque was grainy and lacked flavor. The other people in my party had no complaints about the sandwiches. Just standard fare.  I will say the homemade potato chip were crispy and delicious and I would recommend ordering those. The fries were also solid.   Solid 2.5 star place... I bumped it to 3 bc we had a good time. Come and enjoy the view but dont expect to be blown away.

oTfCKQj6aFBPcm2ckW3l0Q.text: The Grandview Saloon has great outdoor seating on their patio that overlooks the city of Pittsburgh. Their price point is a bit high but I can't help but think it's just a tax for dining with a view lol the variety of aged-steaks, seafood & sandwiches made for a difficult decision of which way to go. I ended up getting the crab cake sandwich which was very filling. My only regret is that I didn't get a chance to try the pork nachos which was the main reason I even went lol (friend from Pburg told me about them)

photos.caption: Photo of Grandview Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from outdoor patio seating. Worth it.

vZ9pGDBHunvMgtLlUkqpRg.text: Awful restaurant. Turned away a group of 14. Hostess said they don't allow children under 5 when we said the smallest was 5 she then said oh we don't seat children under 6. Then the hostess said we're not here to babysit your children. She told us that on their menu it states that they don't seat children under a certain age when we asked to see the menu it was not stated anywhere. I asked to speak to the manager who came out and was completely nasty and unprofessional. We would never give this place our business again. Just so happens another group that we are here visiting Pittsburgh with came to the restaurant yesterday whose daughter is 4 and they were allowed to be seated.
